channel.title: Custom .onion on Whonix: Eschalot, Scallion?
channel.description:
Sory if this has been asked before but cannot find so.
What is best way to make custom hidden service URL when using the excellent Whonix?
I am going to follow these directions: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Hidden_Services#Tor_Hidden_Services_-_EASY
But I want to use a custom URL, at least part of the URL the first 4 or 8 digits. I found a tar of Eschalot v1.2.
This SE question got a good response: https://security.stackexchange.com/questions/29772/how-do-you-get-a-specific-onion-address-for-your-hidden-service
So I look for Eschalot and it's hidden service is down: http://blacksunhq56imku.onion/
But someone posted it's tar on BitCoin forum (v1.2): https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=639410.0
So I downloaded and scanned with VirusTotal which came up clean. Not that that means anything maybe someone here can review the code?: https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/b108d8325fec98c4db258e644053e44810601fc5ab2768c98270560e77a58a95/analysis/
And there's Scallon: https://github.com/lachesis/scallion

item.title: Custom .onion on Whonix: Eschalot, Scallion?
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Its off topic but I’ll chip in. With 16 characters, you are just only getting 80 bit strong RSA keys as your HS name which is suspeced not to be good enough at this time. Using Scallion to insert easier words to remember in the address will only further weaken that margin and make spoofing your Hidden Service name well within the ability of those with serious computing power: NSA.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom .onion on Whonix: Eschalot, Scallion?
item.dc:creator: fortasse
item.description:
I used Scallion. Depending on the speed of your computer and the complexity of the .onion you want, it could be infeasible to create (taking years. You could get lucky, but highly improbable). I have a pretty nice graphics card and a relatively loose constraint (repeating characters)which sped up the process quite a bit, so good luck!

Read full topic

item.title: Custom .onion on Whonix: Eschalot, Scallion?
item.dc:creator: Brian_totally_not_th
item.description:
Great thanks for the suggestions. I’m going to try using it, I’ll update later if it works okay.

And thanks for Whonix!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Custom .onion on Whonix: Eschalot, Scallion?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Hi,
you might get more (and better?) answers if you ask in the more general Tor support places, such as on the tor-talk mailing list, which is linked on Whonix’s support page:

Whonix – 1 May 20

Support - Whonix

Various Ways to get Help with Whonix ™. Free and Professional Support available.

Any answer they give for general Linux/Debian should work on Whonix as well as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About#Based_on_Debian.

Maybe someone else has a better answer. I’ll also notify fortasse (whonix.org webmaster), the person who created whonix.org’s .onion.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom .onion on Whonix: Eschalot, Scallion?
item.dc:creator: Brian_totally_not_th
item.description:
Sory if this has been asked before but cannot find so.

What is best way to make custom hidden service URL when using the excellent Whonix?

I am going to follow these directions:

Whonix – 2 May 20

Onion Services - Whonix

Anonymously host any server with Whonix ™ and Tor onion services

But I want to use a custom URL, at least part of the URL the first 4 or 8 digits. I found a tar of Eschalot v1.2.

This SE question got a good response:

security.stackexchange.com

How do you get a specific .onion address for your hidden service?

tor
asked by user9651 on 08:33PM - 27 Jan 13 UTC

So I look for Eschalot and it’s hidden service is down:
http://blacksunhq56imku.onion/

But someone posted it’s tar on BitCoin forum (v1.2):
https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=639410.0

So I downloaded and scanned with VirusTotal which came up clean. Not that that means anything maybe someone here can review the code?:
https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/b108d8325fec98c4db258e644053e44810601fc5ab2768c98270560e77a58a95/analysis/

And there’s Scallon:

GitHub

lachesis/scallion

GPU-based Onion Hash generator. Contribute to lachesis/scallion development by creating an account on GitHub.

Read full topic
